abstract: Survey conducted by Markit and released by HSBC finds that activity in China's factory sector fell to 11-month low in March; poor reading contributes to indications that country's economy has slowed despite two interest rate cuts since November 2014.
lead_paragraph: Activity contracted, the early reading of a private survey showed, falling to an 11-month low as new orders shrank, signaling weakness in the economy.

headline.main: Pullback in March for China’s Factories
headline.print_headline: Factory Activity in China Drops to an 11-Month Low as the Economy Stutters

snippet: Activity contracted, the early reading of a private survey showed, falling to an 11-month low as new orders shrank, signaling weakness in the economy.
